Package common.msg.room

Interface IAddCommandMsg<M extends IRoomMsg>

  • Type Parameters:
    M - Subclass of IRoomMsg to process
    All Superinterfaces:
    IDataPacketData, IMsg, IRoomMsg, java.io.Serializable
    public interface IAddCommandMsg<M extends IRoomMsg>
extends IRoomMsg
    A message containing the type ID of an unknown message and a command to process a message of that type.
    Whenever a room member receives a IRequestCommandMsg from another member in the room, they should respond by sending back an IAddCommandMsg containing the requested command.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ARoomMsgCmd<M> getCommand()
      Get the command to process one type of unknown message.
      default IDataPacketID getID()
      Get the host ID value associated with the specific implementing data type.

      Retrieve the ID value directly from the interface.

      Factory method to create the data type from an input value.

    • Method Detail

      • GetID

        static IDataPacketID GetID()
        Retrieve the ID value directly from the interface. getID() merely delegates to this method.
        Returns:
        The host ID value associated with this data type.

      • getID

        default IDataPacketID getID()
        Description copied from interface: IDataPacketData
        Get the host ID value associated with the specific implementing data type. This method should be overridden with a default method by the INTERFACE defining the data type.

        NEVER subsequently override the defined default method! Unfortunately, Java has no syntax for defining an invariant method at the interface level. That default method represents the invariant ID value that is associated with the data type defined by the interface it is defined on.

        Since an instance method, such as a default method, can delegate to a static method but not the other way around, the implementation of getID() should simply delegate to the interface's static GetID() method.
        Specified by:
        getID in interface IDataPacketData
        Returns:
        A host ID value compatible with ADataPackets

      • getCommand

        ARoomMsgCmd<M> getCommand()
        Get the command to process one type of unknown message.
        Returns:
        Command to process one type of unknown message.

      • getMsgId

        IDataPacketID getMsgId()
        Get the ID of the unknown message type.
        Returns:
        ID of the unknown message type.

      • make

        static <M extends IRoomMsg> IAddCommandMsg<M> make​(ARoomMsgCmd<M> cmd,
                                                   IDataPacketID msgId)
        Factory method to create the data type from an input value. The problem with this technique is while it does hide the data type implementation, defining it at this interface level means that the implementation is invariant, which is an unnecessary restriction.
        Type Parameters:
        M - Subclass of IMsg to process
        Parameters:
        cmd - Command to process the unknown message.
        msgId - ID of the unknown message type
        Returns:
        An IAddCommandMsg object
